intro: Schoutenia mastersii, commonly known as the Amazonian goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its leaves are typically ovate with a glossy surface. Schoutenia mastersii is often found in humid, low-light environments within the undergrowth of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecological diversity in its native habitat.
